text: Major Thomas Arthur Bird DSO, MC (11 August 1918 â€“ 9 August 2017) was a British soldier of the Second World War. He was awarded two Military Crosses and the Distinguished Service Order. He later became an architect and worked in collaboration with Richard Tyler restoring country houses. Bird died on 9 August 2017 at the age of 98. == References == Category:1918 births Category:2017 deaths Category:British military personnel of World War II Category:English architects Category:Majors in the British Army
title: Thomas A. Bird
